events.name: The Race Start
events.desc: It’s time for the race start! The track is damp, but the rain has stopped. Should we risk it and go for the dry tyres, or play it safe and take intermediates?

strategies.name: Dry Tyres
strategies.desc: Gamble on grip and go for early pace.
strategies.overview: Choosing dry tyres on a damp surface could pay off big — if the track dries quickly, you’ll be flying while others struggle. But in the early laps, grip will be minimal, and one mistake could ruin your race before it begins.
rewards: Early advantage as the track dries
risks: Potential early damage or loss of positions

outcomes.desc: Rapid pace in mid-stint earns major track position.
Undercut opponents who pit for slicks later.
Gain early lead and clear air advantage.
Lose control on Lap 1 and drop down the field.
Cold tyres cause slow getaway and lost positions.
Minor front wing damage after sliding off line.

strategies.name: Intermediate Tyres
strategies.desc: Play it safe and hold steady until the track fully dries.
strategies.overview: Intermediates provide confidence and stability in the early laps but may quickly overheat as the track dries. You’ll need to time the switch to slicks perfectly to avoid falling behind.
risks: Tyres degrade fast on dry surface

outcomes.desc: Steady first stint keeps you in the fight
Avoid early incidents as others struggle
Perfect switch to slicks during safety car
Lose pace rapidly as track dries
Forced into early pit and rejoin in traffic
Overheat tyres and slide in key corners

events.name: Mid-Race Duel
events.desc: We’re halfway through the race, and all on dry tyres now. We have a car close behind, and few close ahead. Is the car capable of pushing to overtake? Or should we try to defend?

strategies.name: Push
strategies.desc: Attack mode - risk it all for the overtake
strategies.overview: You decide to push hard and try to overtake the car ahead. It’s high-risk, high-reward — perfect execution could mean a jump up the order, but overcooking it could ruin your tyres or worse

outcomes.desc: Clean overtake and improved track position
Set fastest lap and close on next rival
Build momentum, morale, and crowd reaction
Lock-up leads to flat spot and lost pace
Contact with rival — minor damage
Spin after pushing beyond grip limit

strategies.name: Defend
strategies.desc: Keep it clean, protect the position
strategies.overview: You opt to hold your ground, conserving tyres and waiting for the race to come to you. This choice is about patience and precision — you may lose pace, but you’ll have more grip for the final laps

outcomes.desc: Hold off rivals and maintain steady position
Stronger tyre condition for the final stint
Force opponents into mistakes behind you
Lose DRS train and time to leaders
Get overtaken by a faster rival
Defensive driving overheats tyres anyway

events.name: The Final Stint
events.desc: The dry tyres are starting to wear quite badly, but we still have 10 laps to go. Should we pit for another set, or stay out?

strategies.name: Pit
strategies.overview: You dive into the pits for a new set of tyres. The fresh grip could make you a rocket in the closing laps — if the time lost in the stop doesn’t cost you too much track position
rewards: Strong finish if traffic is clear

outcomes.desc: Overcut rivals and finish on the podium
Fresh tyres enable rapid late charge
Set fastest lap and earn bonus points
Slow pit stop ruins momentum
Rejoin in traffic and lose time overtaking
Safety car cancels out your tyre advantage

strategies.name: Stay out
strategies.desc: Brave it — hang on till the end
strategies.overview: You choose to stay out, saving the pit time but pushing worn tyres to their limits. If you manage them well, you could pull off a miracle — or lose it all in the final laps

outcomes.desc: Hold off chasing cars for strong finish
Nail tyre management and save podium spot
Strategic gamble pays off with race win
Tyres hit the cliff and lose grip completely
Get overtaken multiple times in closing laps
Late puncture destroys race result
